cab.content: confidential.(54) 284 COPY NO,7th September, 1954CABINET6XPARLIAMENTARY DELEGATION TO THE SOVIET union memorandum by the Secretary of State for Foreign affairs wish to inform my colleagues of the forthcoming visit tothe Soviet Union by a Parliamentary Delegation.2, Invitations to the Lord Chancellor and the Speaker of theHouse of Commons from the President of the Council of the Union.andthe President of the Council of Nationalities were received on 27th July.H.M. Charge d'Affaires in Moscow was instructed to convey acceptanceand to enquire whether it would be agreeable to the Soviet authorities for a Delegation consisting of a maximum of 1 6 members of the two houses of Parliament to arrive in Moscow on 30th September and toleave about 16th October. The Soviet Ministry of Foreign Affairshave now replied agreeing to these proposals.3. In view of recent international developments some Conservativemembers are now reluctant to take part in the visit and I have considered whether it would be desirable to postpone it. But I have come to theconclusion that to do so at this late stage would seriously damage ourrelations with the Soviet Union and might be misunderstood in thiscountry.majesty.Foreign Office, S.W.I. ,7th September, 1954.
